results.title: Blokes and sheds - Bruno
results.creator_credit: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Bruno has built a wooden oven in his shed. He fires the oven up early in the day, to bake the dough that he, his wife Guissepina, and his son Sam, have mixed up in a big wooden trough. By 9am the neighborhood smells of fresh bread as the beautiful rounded loaves are slid out of the oven on a long handled bread board before being eaten dipped in homemade olive oil and accompanied by other delicious flavors from the garden and of course, homemade wine. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Silvio
results.creator_credit: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
In the scenic Adelaide Hills, Silvio, a well-known sculptor, spends all of his time working in his shed. He tells us how he and his family came to grow up in Australia after his father was a Hungarian pilot for the Germans in the war. Silvio began carving when he was five years old, carving bark off pine trees, soap, and bits of wood. He now creates life-sized beautifully ornate carved animals…pelicans, lizards and frogs from wood, stone and bronze. We see Silvio working with true commitment and passion in his enormous shed, as he works on creating the animals that he loves. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: Queensland
results.creator_credit: John Ruane, Chris Fitchett and Film Noir Productions
results.brief_description: This film deals with the fragility of relationships, goals and dreams. The film is a sensitively drawn image of working class existence in one of Melbourne’s industrial suburbs. It is about Doug, who has always wanted to go to Queensland and about his plans that do not work as they are expected to. Stars John Flaus.

results.title: The General
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton, Clyde Bruckman, Joseph Schenck, Buster Keaton Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Keaton’s best, and arguably the greatest screen comedy ever made. Against a meticulously evoked Civil War background, Buster risks life, limb and love as he pursues his beloved railway engine, hijacked by Northern spies up to no good for the Southern cause. The result is everything one could wish for; witty, dramatic, visually stunning, full of subtle, delightful human insights, and constantly hilarious. Cast includes Buster Keaton and Marion Mack. Rated: G

results.title: Meantime
results.brief_description: Meantime is a sympathetic film about unemployment and the jobless. The film is built around the life of a family living in a council flat in the East End of London. Frank, Mavis, Colin and Mark are the four central characters - Frank, Colin and Mark are all unemployed - and the family live a tense, precarious existence in their cramped high-rise flat.

results.title: The Atomic Cafe
results.creator_credit: Jayne Loader, Kevin Rafferty, Pierce Rafferty and Archives Project Production Co
results.brief_description: A painstakingly researched and brilliantly edited compendium of pro-nuclear propaganda from American newsreels, ‘educational’ material, military footage, advertisements, TV shows and pop songs. This was the Cold War at its most icy and all-pervasive, and no area of American popular culture seems to have escaped from its bitter ideological grip. This veritable flood of bizarre, horrifying and often ludicrously comic images is counterpointed on the soundtrack by an array of equally extraordinary songs.

results.title: Scales of justice trilogy
results.creator_credit: Michael Jenkins and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A trilogy of self-contained plays set in a world of law enforcement, vice, drugs, politics and organised crime. The stories are: THE JOB, about a young probationary constable torn between his moral obligations and loyalty; THE GAME, about two drug squad detectives who allow themselves to be compromised; THE NUMBERS, about a young politician whose actions conflict with the views of his parliamentary wing.

results.title: Never weaken; Why worry?
results.brief_description:
Episode of New versions of comedy classics series
In ‘Never Weaken’ Lloyd’s last short, (he subsequently made features), he hustles customers for his girlfriend who works for an osteopath. Cast also includes Mildred Davis, Roy Brooks, Charles A. Stevenson. In ‘Why Worry?’, Harold plays a rich hypochondriac visiting Latin America to cure his many ills. Oblivious of all around him, he becomes embroiled in a revolution without realising it. Cast also includes Jobyna Ralston, John Aasen, Leo White.

results.title: The Trial (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Alexander Salkind, Orson Welles, Fl. C. It., Hisa-Film and Paris-Europa Productions
results.brief_description: Welles neglected masterpiece is a stunning adaptation of Franz Kafka’s existential novel about a man who is caught in an increasingly bizarre and sinister bureaucratic world. One morning K (Anthony Perkins) is awoken by the police who have come to arrest him on a charge that no-one will explain. As the innocent K becomes more and more entangled in the nightmare of bureaucracy he slowly assumes the guilty role that he has been accused off. Filmed in black and white and in a style that recalls the experiments of expressionism, “The Trial” is both a rare successful film version of a uniquely literary work as well as an important and underrated film in Welles’ oeuvre. Cast includes Jeanne Moreau, Romy Schneider, Elsa Martinelli, Orson Welles, Akim Tamiroff.
